lexUnit.name: thump.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a heavy dull blow or noise

sentence.text: The thump and fumes of the freezer plant 's heavy diesel generator were the only unwelcome intrusion .
The lift heralded its own approach with regular heavy thumps and groans , and while he waited Creed looked round at the high-ceilinged and municipal-tiled hallway .
The lid closed with a heavy thump and Fenn stood , relieved that it was done .
The chain snapped on and there was a thump as Brian was hit , then some more noise and Abu Salim stormed out .
There was a thump as his shopping hit the floor .
And in the end he heard something , a muffled thump that came from somewhere in the shadows on the far side of the mill yard , a door being pulled shut .
standing terrified by the door , I saw an officer lean forward on his horse and hit a neighbour with his truncheon above the eyes , heard the blow like the thump of wood on a swede turnip .
The thump of the ball jerked the pram , which was standing on a slight slope .
Every now and then , we hear staccato bursts of gunfire , with the occasional thump of artillery .
The thump of each explosion sounded like a door being slammed far beneath our feet .
The thump of a shell hitting the far end of the barrack building brought him wide awake .
She could feel the uneven thump of her heart through the silky , Oriental-patterned material of her blouse , while her brain was whirring …
I hear the thump of the cat flap as Cat O'Fun tumbles through it without the feline grace of his fellows .
The thump of a fist on his shoulder .
The thump of the wall against his back .
Somewhere , distantly , he could hear the rush of sea , and the steady thump of the living earth , a strange , regular drum beat , that seemed to expand to fill his mind .
The script called for a pistol shot , the thump of Williams falling to the ground and Paddick left with the last line .
The thump of Jekub hitting the door had knocked all the breath out of him .
The distant gunfire was now interspersed by the faint sound of police whistles and the loud thump of thunderflashes .
He dipped the headlights and the far end of the tunnel seemed to leap towards us , bouncing up and down to the thump of our tyres on the sleepers .
The thump of the back wheel coming back into the gutter brought Bob 's window down .
The main enemy attack was still nothing but a sound of blended menace ; a crashing noise in the rye , a thump of drums and a deep-throated cheer .
Then , from behind him , from the north , he heard the thump of heavy drums and the jaunty thin notes of a flute playing .
And there was a thump from overhead .
There was sudden rush of air and a thump from right behind them .
A muffled thump from below , somewhere at the foot of the stairs .

All my men were dressed as doctors , -- with their white smocks , their dangling stethoscopes , their talk and their laughter and their cigarettes , waiting for the familiar volley of shouts and thumps from within .
As she hesitated outside Bob 's door she heard a muffled metallic thump from within , as of a saucepan being put down on a gas-stove , then the sound of a tap being turned on .
